text.tspan: Use Storyboards to create a narrative that focuses on people and their actions, thoughts, goals, emotions, and relationships.
Combine quick sketches with speech and thought bubbles, captions, and narration.
Write a use case or problem to be solved visually…

tspan.tspan: A storyboard in UX is a tool that visually predicts and explores
a user’s experience with a product. It presents a product very
much like a movie in terms of how people will use it.
Pose the use case or problem with a simple statement to
the team give context and backstory.
Either in small groups or alone, roughly sketch a thumbnail
in each frame of the storyboard to tell the story. Emphasize
each moment. It doesn’t have to be high fidelity but easy to
Convey what the character feels during each step. Try to
give a feeling for what’s going on in the character’s head.
You should write a caption describing each frame to give
more context. You can also show a character’s thinking with
Show it to your team and walk them through the
storyboard and answer any questions. Compare yours to other
Have your team vote on the storyboard that best captures
